```{r Data PIPELINE}

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(broom)
library(dplyr)
library(palmerpenguins)

# Load the penguins dataset
data("penguins", package = "palmerpenguins")

# Handling missing values in relevant columns
penguins_clean <- penguins %>%
  filter(!is.na(bill_length_mm)) %>%
  filter(!is.na(bill_depth_mm))

# Creating an exploratory figure (not a boxplot)
ggplot(penguins_clean, aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm)) + 
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Exploratory Analysis of Penguin Data", x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Bill Depth (mm)")

# Saving the figure
ggsave("exploratory_figure.png")

# Example: t-test or ANOVA depending on your data and hypothesis
# Using 'species' as a grouping variable for demonstration
test_result <- t.test(bill_length_mm ~ species, data = penguins_clean)

# Creating a results figure based on the statistical test
ggplot(penguins_clean, aes(x = species, y = bill_length_mm, fill = species)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Results of Statistical Analysis", x = "Species", y = "Bill Length (mm)")

# Saving the figure
ggsave("results_figure.png")

# Displaying the results of the statistical test
print(test_result)
```
